page.title: 10Meriden-Local History 1.
page.content:
Meriden was mentioned in the original Domesday Book, and at that time the land was held by the{Countess Godiva ,wife of Earl Leofric. She became famous for her exploits as a horsewoman through the city streets of Coventry, if the old tale is to be believed!!!
The original name of the village was {Alspath,}places of that name still appear in the village, but from the 15th Century onwards it was known as {Meriden.
The village grew with the importance of the road from London to Holyhead, and when the road was turnpiked in l821, trade increased still further.
